contents.text:
Student email: student@example.com
Study plan:
{"rationale":"I grouped the 3 curated learning paths as the backbone because they map directly to the highest-weight AZ-104 domains (identity/governance, storage, networking). Since you’re advanced and time-boxed to 8 weeks at ~6 hours/week, the pacing prioritizes exam-aligned scenarios and hands-on reps over broad fundamentals. Networking is spaced across two weeks (heaviest/most error-prone domain), with built-in review days before progressing. Storage security is placed immediately after core storage concepts to preserve prerequisite flow (accounts → data services → security). Monitoring/VM modules are inserted after networking to reinforce operational skills (diagnostics, Azure Monitor) and round out the “monitor and maintain” domain. Each week ends with a checkpoint deliverable (mini-lab + self-quiz/notes) to verify readiness before moving on.","planTitle":"AZ-104 (Advanced) — 8-Week Milestone Study Plan (6 hrs/week)","durationWeeks":8,"weeklyHours":6,"weeklyMilestones":[{"weekNumber":1,"objective":"Identity & governance foundations (Entra ID basics, RBAC, scope) and a working admin baseline for the rest of the plan.","sessions":[{"day":"Day 1","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Learning Path: AZ-104 Manage identities and governance in Azure — complete the first section focused on Entra ID tenants/users/groups basics","Create a 1-page ‘identity objects & terminology’ cheat sheet (tenant, user, group, service principal, managed identity)"]},{"day":"Day 2","durationMinutes":45,"tasks":["Continue the learning path: authentication/authorization concepts as presented (focus on admin-relevant choices)","Write down 10 likely exam ‘which identity object/feature fits’ prompts (Q-style)"]},{"day":"Day 3","durationMinutes":45,"tasks":["Learning path: RBAC fundamentals and role assignment flow","Practice mental model: management group → subscription → resource group → resource (scope inheritance)"]},{"day":"Day 4","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Learning path: subscriptions/governance overview (resource groups, tagging, locks)","Create a ‘governance controls’ grid: tags vs locks vs policy vs RBAC (what each does/doesn’t do)"]},{"day":"Day 5","durationMinutes":45,"tasks":["Targeted review: re-skim key pages from the week’s modules; fill gaps in cheat sheets","Checkpoint prep: draft 15 flashcards (RBAC scope, locks, tags, core Entra concepts)"]},{"day":"Day 6","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Hands-on mini-lab (portal/CLI/PowerShell—your choice): create RG, apply tags, apply a ReadOnly lock, assign a built-in RBAC role at RG scope, verify effective permissions","Record commands/steps in notes (reusable exam recall)"]}],"checkpoint":"You can explain and apply RBAC at different scopes, differentiate locks/tags/policy/RBAC, and complete a mini-lab that demonstrates RBAC + governance controls."},{"weekNumber":2,"objective":"Identity & governance deeper pass: policy/management groups and operational governance decision-making.","sessions":[{"day":"Day 1","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Learning Path: continue identity/governance — focus on Azure Policy concepts and initiative vs policy definition","Note common effects: Deny/Audit/Append/DeployIfNotExists"]},{"day":"Day 2","durationMinutes":45,"tasks":["Learning path: management groups and subscription organization (if included in path)","Make a hierarchy diagram for a fictional org and where you’d enforce policy vs RBAC"]},{"day":"Day 3","durationMinutes":45,"tasks":["Learning path: role assignment troubleshooting patterns (least privilege, inheritance, explicit deny patterns)","Write a short ‘RBAC troubleshooting checklist’"]},{"day":"Day 4","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Scenario practice (self-made): 6 scenarios mapping requirement → control (RBAC vs lock vs policy vs tag)","Review answers and refine your governance grid"]},{"day":"Day 5","durationMinutes":45,"tasks":["Consolidation: merge Week 1–2 notes into one AZ-104 Governance/Identity cheat sheet","Create 20 flashcards total for identity/governance"]},{"day":"Day 6","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Hands-on mini-lab: create a simple policy assignment (e.g., allowed locations), test non-compliant deployment attempt, document expected behavior","Checkpoint quiz: answer 15 questions from your flashcards without notes"]}],"checkpoint":"You can select the correct governance feature for a requirement, describe policy effects, and demonstrate a policy assignment + expected compliance outcome."},{"weekNumber":3,"objective":"Storage core: storage accounts, data services, access patterns, and operational configuration.","sessions":[{"day":"Day 1","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Learning Path: AZ-104 Implement and manage storage — storage account fundamentals (types, redundancy options, performance tiers)","Create a decision table: LRS/ZRS/GRS/GZRS (when/why)"]},{"day":"Day 2","durationMinutes":45,"tasks":["Continue learning path: Blob storage concepts (containers, access tiers, lifecycle basics if covered)","Write 5 ‘choose the right redundancy/access tier’ prompts"]},{"day":"Day 3","durationMinutes":45,"tasks":["Continue learning path: Azure Files basics and common admin tasks (shares, connectivity considerations)","Note common use cases and constraints"]},{"day":"Day 4","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Continue learning path: storage networking basics (endpoints, firewall concepts if included)","Hands-on: create a storage account and a blob container; upload/download a test file"]},{"day":"Day 5","durationMinutes":45,"tasks":["Review day: revisit your redundancy decision table and correct misunderstandings","Create 15 flashcards for storage terms and configuration choices"]},{"day":"Day 6","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Hands-on mini-lab: create a file share + test access method (as feasible), and practice changing redundancy/performance settings where applicable","Document what is configurable after creation vs locked-in choices"]}],"checkpoint":"You can choose appropriate redundancy, explain Blob vs Files use cases, and perform basic storage account + blob/files tasks with documented ‘immutable vs mutable’ settings."},{"weekNumber":4,"objective":"Storage security & access control: SAS, authZ/authN choices, and hardening patterns commonly tested on AZ-104.","sessions":[{"day":"Day 1","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Module: Configure Azure Storage security — complete first half (focus on authentication/authorization options, access models)","Update notes: ‘preferred auth’ patterns and common pitfalls"]},{"day":"Day 2","durationMinutes":45,"tasks":["Continue module: SAS concepts (account SAS vs service SAS vs user delegation SAS if covered)","Create a mini decision tree: when to use SAS vs RBAC vs access keys"]},{"day":"Day 3","durationMinutes":45,"tasks":["Learning Path: continue storage path sections that cover security/authorization/networking settings","Write 6 scenario-based Q&As (secure public access, key rotation, least privilege)"]},{"day":"Day 4","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Hands-on mini-lab: generate a SAS with limited permissions and expiry; validate access; then revoke/rotate as appropriate to observe behavior","Document steps and what breaks access"]},{"day":"Day 5","durationMinutes":45,"tasks":["Review: consolidate storage notes into a single ‘Storage Admin’ cheat sheet (redundancy, services, security, troubleshooting)","Flashcards: add 10 security-focused cards"]},{"day":"Day 6","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Mixed drill: 20-question self-quiz from your storage flashcards + scenario prompts","Targeted re-read of any weak points discovered during quiz"]}],"checkpoint":"You can explain and apply storage security controls (especially SAS and secure access patterns) and complete a lab demonstrating time/permission-scoped access."},{"weekNumber":5,"objective":"Networking core I: VNet/subnet design, NSGs, and routing basics.","sessions":[{"day":"Day 1","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Learning Path: AZ-104 Configure and manage virtual networks — VNet/subnet fundamentals and planning considerations","Create a quick reference: CIDR, subnet sizing, reserved IP basics (as applicable)"]},{"day":"Day 2","durationMinutes":45,"tasks":["Continue learning path: NSGs and rule evaluation (priority, inbound/outbound, stateful behavior)","Write 8 ‘allow/deny’ rule evaluation exercises"]},{"day":"Day 3","durationMinutes":45,"tasks":["Continue learning path: route tables / UDR basics and when they matter","Note interactions: system routes vs UDR; common exam ‘why can’t it reach’ patterns"]},{"day":"Day 4","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Hands-on mini-lab: create VNet + subnets; apply NSG; test connectivity conceptually (or via simple VM test later)","Document NSG rule ordering examples"]},{"day":"Day 5","durationMinutes":45,"tasks":["Review: rework your 8 NSG evaluation exercises until correct without notes","Create 15 flashcards for networking terms/rule evaluation"]},{"day":"Day 6","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Scenario set: 6 networking scenarios (segmentation, restrict inbound, service access) and pick correct feature (NSG vs route vs peering)","Add misses to a ‘networking mistakes’ list"]}],"checkpoint":"You can design VNets/subnets, correctly predict NSG rule outcomes, and explain when routing tables/UDRs affect connectivity."},{"weekNumber":6,"objective":"Networking core II: peering, name resolution patterns, and pulling the networking domain together with scenario practice.","sessions":[{"day":"Day 1","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Learning path: VNet peering and core behaviors/constraints (transitivity, gateway transit concepts if covered)","Create a peering checklist: what to verify when peering ‘doesn’t work’"]},{"day":"Day 2","durationMinutes":45,"tasks":["Continue learning path: DNS/name resolution as presented; note default Azure-provided DNS vs custom","Write 5 ‘which DNS option’ prompts"]},{"day":"Day 3","durationMinutes":45,"tasks":["Continue learning path: any remaining networking modules (core services included in the path)","Update your networking cheat sheet with ‘default behaviors’ (common exam traps)"]},{"day":"Day 4","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Hands-on mini-lab: create two VNets and peer them; validate effective settings (as feasible)","Document key peering settings and expected outcomes"]},{"day":"Day 5","durationMinutes":45,"tasks":["Review: flashcards (networking) + 15-minute recap of Week 5 notes","Do a 15-question networking-only self-quiz (from your own prompts/flashcards)"]},{"day":"Day 6","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Cumulative networking scenarios: 10 mixed problems (NSG + routing + peering) and explain your reasoning in 2–3 sentences each","Identify top 5 weak spots to revisit in Week 7 review blocks"]}],"checkpoint":"You can configure and troubleshoot peering at a high level, choose DNS approaches for common needs, and solve mixed networking scenarios reliably."},{"weekNumber":7,"objective":"Compute + monitoring: VM fundamentals refresher and operational monitoring for AZ-104 ‘monitor and maintain’ coverage.","sessions":[{"day":"Day 1","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Module: Introduction to Azure virtual machines — complete half (focus on sizing, availability considerations, management basics)","Create a VM checklist: region, size, disk, NIC/VNet, identity/permissions"]},{"day":"Day 2","durationMinutes":45,"tasks":["Finish VM intro module","Write 5 VM scenario prompts (resize, redeploy, disks, availability choices)"]},{"day":"Day 3","durationMinutes":45,"tasks":["Module: Monitor your Azure virtual machines with Azure Monitor — complete first half (metrics vs logs, diagnostics/agent concepts as covered)","Note: what you monitor (platform metrics, guest metrics/logs) and where it goes"]},{"day":"Day 4","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Finish Azure Monitor module","Hands-on mini-lab: enable monitoring/diagnostic settings where feasible; locate metrics/logs views and save key steps"]},{"day":"Day 5","durationMinutes":45,"tasks":["Review block: revisit Week 6 weak spots (top 5) for 25 minutes + 20 minutes of VM/Monitor flashcards","Update your ‘common traps’ list"]},{"day":"Day 6","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Integrated scenario practice: 8 scenarios combining networking + VM + monitoring decisions (e.g., can’t reach VM, identify whether NSG/route/DNS; then what to monitor)","Write 1-page ‘Ops runbook’ summary for VM troubleshooting order of operations"]}],"checkpoint":"You can make core VM admin decisions, distinguish metrics vs logs at a practical level, and outline a repeatable VM connectivity + monitoring troubleshooting approach."},{"weekNumber":8,"objective":"Final consolidation and exam-readiness: targeted review across domains using your notes, flashcards, and mini-labs.","sessions":[{"day":"Day 1","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Governance/Identity review: re-read your cheat sheet + do 20 flashcards","Re-do the policy/RBAC feature-selection scenarios (Week 2) without notes"]},{"day":"Day 2","durationMinutes":45,"tasks":["Storage review: 20 flashcards + redo 6 storage security scenarios (SAS/auth choices)","Revisit your redundancy decision table and validate it’s consistent"]},{"day":"Day 3","durationMinutes":45,"tasks":["Networking review: 25 minutes on NSG rule evaluation exercises + 20 minutes on peering/routing notes","Rebuild (from memory) your networking cheat sheet headings"]},{"day":"Day 4","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Monitoring/VM review: 15 flashcards + re-walk your monitoring lab steps from notes","Create a 1-page ‘Monitor & troubleshoot’ summary (signals, tools, first checks)"]},{"day":"Day 5","durationMinutes":45,"tasks":["Cross-domain scenario set: 12 mixed scenarios (identity/governance + storage + network + VM/monitor). Write answers + 1-line justification each","Mark any scenario you’re not 100% confident on for Day 6"]},{"day":"Day 6","durationMinutes":60,"tasks":["Final reinforcement: revisit weakest 6 scenarios; re-open the relevant Microsoft Learn unit(s) quickly and correct notes","Checkpoint: do a 30-minute closed-notes recall (write down key facts/steps by domain) then compare to your cheat sheets"]}],"checkpoint":"You can answer mixed-domain scenarios with justification, have compact domain cheat sheets, and can do closed-notes recall of key admin actions and decision criteria."}],"briefMessageToUser":"This 8-week plan uses your curated AZ-104 Microsoft Learn paths as the spine, adds targeted storage security + VM monitoring modules for coverage, and builds in weekly mini-labs plus frequent review to keep recall high. If you keep sessions tight (45–60 minutes) and maintain your cheat sheets/flashcards, you’ll finish with exam-aligned scenario readiness across identity/governance, storage, networking, and monitoring."}

Produce JSON only matching the provided schema

{"rationale":"This engagement plan mirrors the student’s 8-week AZ-104 schedule (6 sessions/week) and keeps reminders tightly aligned to each day’s concrete deliverable (Learn module/path progress, notes/flashcards, scenarios, and mini-labs). Each reminder includes the most relevant official Microsoft Learn/Docs link so the student can start immediately, while weekly checkpoints and review nudges reinforce retention and exam-style decision making across identity/governance, storage, networking, compute, and monitoring.","recipientEmail":"student@example.com","reminderscommentary":[{"schedule":"2026-02-24T18:00:00","subject":"Week 1 Day 1 — Entra ID basics + identity cheat sheet","body":"Today, complete the first section of the AZ-104 identity/governance learning path (Entra ID tenants/users/groups) and finish your 1-page identity objects cheat sheet—keep it tight and exam-oriented.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/paths/manage-identities-governance-azure/"},{"schedule":"2026-02-25T18:00:00","subject":"Week 1 Day 2 — AuthN/AuthZ concepts + 10 exam prompts","body":"Continue the identity/governance path focusing on authentication vs authorization, then write 10 Q-style prompts (which identity object/feature fits) to sharpen exam selection skills.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/paths/manage-identities-governance-azure/"},{"schedule":"2026-02-26T18:00:00","subject":"Week 1 Day 3 — RBAC fundamentals + scope inheritance model","body":"Knock out the RBAC fundamentals section and rehearse the scope chain (management group → subscription → RG → resource) until you can explain inheritance in one pass.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/control-and-organize-with-azure-resource-manager/"},{"schedule":"2026-02-27T18:00:00","subject":"Week 1 Day 4 — Subscriptions/governance + controls grid","body":"Cover subscriptions/governance (RGs, tagging, locks) and build your grid comparing tags vs locks vs policy vs RBAC—this pays off big in scenario questions.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/paths/manage-identities-governance-azure/"},{"schedule":"2026-02-28T10:00:00","subject":"Week 1 Day 5 — Targeted review + 15 flashcards","body":"Re-skim the week’s key pages and close any gaps, then draft 15 flashcards (RBAC scope, locks/tags, core Entra concepts) for fast daily recall.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/paths/manage-identities-governance-azure/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-01T10:00:00","subject":"Week 1 Day 6 — Mini-lab: RG/tags/lock + RBAC role assignment","body":"Do the mini-lab end-to-end (RG + tags + ReadOnly lock + built-in role at RG scope) and write down exact steps/commands so you can reproduce them under exam pressure.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/role-based-access-control/role-assignments-portal"},{"schedule":"2026-03-03T18:00:00","subject":"Week 2 Day 1 — Azure Policy basics + effects notes","body":"Focus today on Azure Policy and the difference between initiatives vs policy definitions; capture the key effects (Deny/Audit/Append/DeployIfNotExists) in your notes.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/implement-azure-policy/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-04T18:00:00","subject":"Week 2 Day 2 — Management groups + enforcement diagram","body":"Study management groups/subscription organization, then draw your fictional org hierarchy showing where policy vs RBAC should be enforced for clean governance.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/governance/management-groups/overview"},{"schedule":"2026-03-05T18:00:00","subject":"Week 2 Day 3 — RBAC troubleshooting checklist","body":"Work through RBAC troubleshooting patterns (least privilege, inheritance, explicit deny) and produce a short checklist you can apply to any ‘access doesn’t work’ scenario.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/role-based-access-control/troubleshooting"},{"schedule":"2026-03-06T18:00:00","subject":"Week 2 Day 4 — 6 governance scenarios (control selection)","body":"Run 6 self-made scenarios mapping requirement → control (RBAC vs lock vs policy vs tag) and refine your governance grid based on any misses.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/governance/azure-policy/overview"},{"schedule":"2026-03-07T10:00:00","subject":"Week 2 Day 5 — Consolidate notes + 20 total flashcards","body":"Merge Week 1–2 into one tight Governance/Identity cheat sheet and bring your flashcards up to 20 total—opt for rules-of-thumb and common traps.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/paths/manage-identities-governance-azure/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-08T10:00:00","subject":"Week 2 Day 6 — Policy assignment lab + 15-question flashcard quiz","body":"Create and test a simple policy assignment (e.g., allowed locations), document expected compliance behavior, then do a 15-question closed-notes flashcard check.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/governance/azure-policy/assign-policy-portal"},{"schedule":"2026-03-10T18:00:00","subject":"Week 3 Day 1 — Storage accounts fundamentals + redundancy table","body":"Complete storage account fundamentals and build your LRS/ZRS/GRS/GZRS decision table—make it ‘when/why’ not just definitions.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/paths/az-104-manage-storage/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-11T18:00:00","subject":"Week 3 Day 2 — Blob storage + 5 tier/redundancy prompts","body":"Continue with Blob concepts (containers, access tiers, lifecycle if covered) and write 5 prompts that force you to choose the right redundancy/tier quickly.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/explore-azure-blob-storage/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-12T18:00:00","subject":"Week 3 Day 3 — Azure Files basics + use cases/constraints","body":"Cover Azure Files basics and record practical admin notes (shares, connectivity considerations, when Files beats Blob) for scenario recall.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/implement-azure-files/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-13T18:00:00","subject":"Week 3 Day 4 — Storage networking + hands-on blob container","body":"Review storage networking concepts and do the hands-on: create a storage account + blob container and verify upload/download so you remember the exact clicks/commands.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/storage/common/storage-account-create"},{"schedule":"2026-03-14T10:00:00","subject":"Week 3 Day 5 — Storage review + 15 flashcards","body":"Revisit your redundancy table until it’s consistent, then create 15 storage flashcards focused on configuration choices and admin outcomes.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/paths/az-104-manage-storage/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-15T10:00:00","subject":"Week 3 Day 6 — Mini-lab: file share + mutable vs immutable settings","body":"Create a file share and test an access method you can execute today; document what can/can’t be changed after creation (this shows up in real admin scenarios).","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/storage/files/storage-how-to-create-file-share"},{"schedule":"2026-03-17T18:00:00","subject":"Week 4 Day 1 — Storage security module (AuthN/AuthZ) + pitfalls","body":"Complete the first half of the Storage security module focusing on authN/authZ options, then update your notes with ‘preferred auth’ patterns and pitfalls.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/configure-storage-security/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-18T18:00:00","subject":"Week 4 Day 2 — SAS types + decision tree","body":"Finish the SAS concepts (account vs service vs user delegation where applicable) and create a mini decision tree: SAS vs RBAC vs access keys.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/storage/common/storage-sas-overview"},{"schedule":"2026-03-19T18:00:00","subject":"Week 4 Day 3 — Storage security sections + 6 scenario Q&As","body":"Continue the storage path’s security/authorization/networking sections and write 6 scenario Q&As (public access, key rotation, least privilege) to lock in decisions.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/paths/az-104-manage-storage/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-20T18:00:00","subject":"Week 4 Day 4 — Mini-lab: generate/validate/revoke SAS","body":"Generate a tightly scoped SAS (permissions + expiry), validate access, then revoke/rotate to observe what breaks—document the steps and expected behavior.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/storage/common/storage-sas-overview#best-practices-when-using-sas"},{"schedule":"2026-03-21T10:00:00","subject":"Week 4 Day 5 — Consolidate ‘Storage Admin’ cheat sheet + 10 security flashcards","body":"Consolidate everything into one Storage Admin cheat sheet (services + redundancy + security + troubleshooting) and add 10 security-focused flashcards.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/configure-storage-security/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-22T10:00:00","subject":"Week 4 Day 6 — Mixed storage drill (20Q) + targeted re-read","body":"Run your 20-question storage self-quiz and immediately re-read the exact units you missed to correct notes while the gaps are fresh.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/paths/az-104-manage-storage/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-24T18:00:00","subject":"Week 5 Day 1 — VNet/subnet fundamentals + IP planning reference","body":"Start the AZ-104 virtual networking path and build a quick IP planning reference (CIDR, subnet sizing, reserved IP basics) you can use for design questions.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/paths/configure-manage-virtual-networks/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-25T18:00:00","subject":"Week 5 Day 2 — NSGs + 8 rule evaluation exercises","body":"Cover NSGs and rule evaluation, then do 8 allow/deny exercises until you can predict outcomes without second-guessing priorities and statefulness.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-network/network-security-groups-overview"},{"schedule":"2026-03-26T18:00:00","subject":"Week 5 Day 3 — Route tables/UDR basics + connectivity failure patterns","body":"Learn route tables/UDRs and write down the top ‘why can’t it reach’ patterns (system routes vs UDR interactions) for troubleshooting scenarios.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-network/virtual-networks-udr-overview"},{"schedule":"2026-03-27T18:00:00","subject":"Week 5 Day 4 — Mini-lab: VNet/subnets + NSG + rule ordering notes","body":"Create a VNet + subnets, apply an NSG, and document a few rule-ordering examples so you can explain exactly why traffic is allowed/blocked.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-network/tutorial-filter-network-traffic"},{"schedule":"2026-03-28T10:00:00","subject":"Week 5 Day 5 — NSG exercise redo + 15 networking flashcards","body":"Redo your NSG evaluation exercises until you’re correct without notes, then add 15 networking flashcards focused on decision rules and defaults.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-network/network-security-groups-overview#security-rules"},{"schedule":"2026-03-29T10:00:00","subject":"Week 5 Day 6 — 6 networking scenarios + ‘mistakes’ list","body":"Work through 6 networking scenarios and choose the right feature (NSG vs route vs peering); add every miss to your networking mistakes list for Week 7 review.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/paths/configure-manage-virtual-networks/"},{"schedule":"2026-03-31T18:00:00","subject":"Week 6 Day 1 — VNet peering behaviors + troubleshooting checklist","body":"Study VNet peering behaviors/constraints and build a checklist for when peering ‘doesn’t work’ (settings, address space, gateways, effective routes).","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-network/virtual-network-peering-overview"},{"schedule":"2026-04-01T18:00:00","subject":"Week 6 Day 2 — DNS options + 5 prompts","body":"Cover Azure DNS/name resolution patterns and write 5 prompts that force you to choose between Azure-provided DNS vs custom DNS for common requirements.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-network/virtual-networks-name-resolution-for-vms-and-role-instances"},{"schedule":"2026-04-02T18:00:00","subject":"Week 6 Day 3 — Finish networking modules + default behaviors cheat sheet","body":"Wrap remaining networking units and update your cheat sheet with default behaviors (the usual exam traps) so you don’t over-configure in scenarios.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/paths/configure-manage-virtual-networks/"},{"schedule":"2026-04-03T18:00:00","subject":"Week 6 Day 4 — Mini-lab: peer two VNets + document outcomes","body":"Create two VNets and peer them, then document key settings and expected outcomes so you can reason about connectivity questions quickly.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-network/tutorial-connect-virtual-networks-portal"},{"schedule":"2026-04-04T10:00:00","subject":"Week 6 Day 5 — Networking flashcards + 15Q self-quiz","body":"Do a flashcard sweep plus a quick recap of Week 5 notes, then complete a 15-question networking-only quiz from your own prompts.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/paths/configure-manage-virtual-networks/"},{"schedule":"2026-04-05T10:00:00","subject":"Week 6 Day 6 — 10 cumulative networking scenarios + top 5 weak spots","body":"Solve 10 mixed NSG/routing/peering problems and write 2–3 sentences of reasoning each; identify your top 5 weak spots to target in Week 7 review.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-network/virtual-network-troubleshoot-peering-issues"},{"schedule":"2026-04-07T18:00:00","subject":"Week 7 Day 1 — VM intro (half) + VM build checklist","body":"Complete half of the VM intro module (sizing, availability, management basics) and produce a VM checklist (region/size/disk/NIC/VNet/identity).","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/intro-to-azure-virtual-machines/"},{"schedule":"2026-04-08T18:00:00","subject":"Week 7 Day 2 — Finish VM module + 5 scenarios","body":"Finish the VM intro module and write 5 VM scenario prompts (resize, redeploy, disks, availability choices) to keep it exam-realistic.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/intro-to-azure-virtual-machines/"},{"schedule":"2026-04-09T18:00:00","subject":"Week 7 Day 3 — Azure Monitor for VMs (half) + metrics vs logs notes","body":"Complete the first half of the Azure Monitor for VMs module and clearly note metrics vs logs, plus what’s platform vs guest signal and where it lands.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/monitor-azure-virtual-machines/"},{"schedule":"2026-04-10T18:00:00","subject":"Week 7 Day 4 — Finish Monitor module + enable/locate signals (mini-lab)","body":"Finish the Monitor module and do a mini-lab enabling monitoring/diagnostic settings where feasible; save the exact navigation/steps in notes for fast recall.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/monitor-azure-virtual-machines/"},{"schedule":"2026-04-11T10:00:00","subject":"Week 7 Day 5 — Review top 5 weak spots + VM/Monitor flashcards","body":"Spend 25 minutes on your Week 6 weak spots, then do 20 minutes of VM/Monitor flashcards and update your common traps list based on what felt shaky.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/monitor-azure-virtual-machines/"},{"schedule":"2026-04-12T10:00:00","subject":"Week 7 Day 6 — 8 integrated ops scenarios + 1-page troubleshooting runbook","body":"Do 8 integrated scenarios (networking + VM + monitoring) and finish a 1-page ops runbook for VM connectivity troubleshooting order of operations.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/virtual-network/virtual-network-troubleshoot-network-connectivity"},{"schedule":"2026-04-14T18:00:00","subject":"Week 8 Day 1 — Identity/Governance final review + redo control-selection scenarios","body":"Re-read your governance/identity cheat sheet and do 20 flashcards, then redo the Week 2 policy/RBAC feature-selection scenarios without notes.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/paths/manage-identities-governance-azure/"},{"schedule":"2026-04-15T18:00:00","subject":"Week 8 Day 2 — Storage final review + SAS/auth scenarios","body":"Do 20 storage flashcards and redo 6 storage security scenarios (SAS/auth choices), then sanity-check your redundancy decision table for consistency.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/paths/az-104-manage-storage/"},{"schedule":"2026-04-16T18:00:00","subject":"Week 8 Day 3 — Networking final review + rebuild cheat sheet headings","body":"Spend 25 minutes on NSG rule evaluation plus 20 minutes on peering/routing notes, then rebuild your networking cheat sheet headings from memory.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/paths/configure-manage-virtual-networks/"},{"schedule":"2026-04-17T18:00:00","subject":"Week 8 Day 4 — VM/Monitor review + 1-page monitor & checks).","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/training/modules/monitor-azure-virtual-machines/"},{"schedule":"2026-04-18T10:00:00","subject":"Week 8 Day 5 — 12 cross-domain scenarios + mark uncertain items","body":"Complete 12 mixed scenarios with a 1-line justification each, and mark anything you’re not 100% on so Day 6 can be a precise, high-value fix.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/credentials/certifications/azure-administrator/?practice-assessment-type=certification"},{"schedule":"2026-04-19T10:00:00","subject":"Week 8 Day 6 — Fix weakest 6 + quick Learn re-open + 30-min closed-notes recall","body":"Revisit your weakest 6 scenarios and quickly re-open the relevant Learn units to correct notes, then do a 30-minute closed-notes recall by domain and compare to your cheat sheets.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/credentials/certifications/azure-administrator/"},{"schedule":"2026-04-19T18:00:00","subject":"Week 8 Checkpoint — readiness confirmation","body":"Before you wrap the plan, confirm you can justify answers across mixed domains and reproduce key admin steps from memory; lock your final cheat sheets as your last-week review pack.","link":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/credentials/certifications/exams/az-104/"}],"motivationMessages":[{"schedule":"2026-02-26T08:30:00","body":"Keep sessions outcome-based: if you finish the Learn unit early, spend the remaining minutes turning it into flashcards or a checklist—this is what sticks on exam day."},{"schedule":"2026-03-09T08:30:00","body":"Governance is mostly ‘choose the right control’—aim to answer every scenario with a one-sentence rule (e.g., “Policy enforces, RBAC grants, locks protect”)."},{"schedule":"2026-03-23T08:30:00","body":"For storage and networking, your edge comes from decision tables and defaults—review the tables briefly before each session to keep choices automatic."},{"schedule":"2026-04-06T08:30:00","body":"If a networking scenario feels hard, force yourself to write the reasoning in 2–3 sentences; clarity beats speed and improves accuracy fast."},{"schedule":"2026-04-13T08:30:00","body":"Final week mindset: don’t re-learn everything—attack weak spots, do closed-notes recall, and tighten cheat sheets into quick-scan pages."}],"briefMessageToUser":"You’ll get one reminder per scheduled study session (with a direct Microsoft Learn/Docs link) plus a few light motivation nudges to keep consistency high. Keep each session deliverable-focused (cheat sheet, flashcards, scenario answers, or a mini-lab note) and you’ll finish Week 8 with strong exam-ready recall across all AZ-104 domains."}
